required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Age-related Differences in Response to Pituitary Stimulation Tests
clinical_study.official_title: Age-related Differences in the Response to a Combined Pituitary Stimulation Test With TRH, LHRH and ACTH

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study to age-related differences to the response of a combined pituitary stimulation test with TRH, LHRH and ACTH.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be recruited in three different age intervals: 18-45 years, 55-80 years and 80+ years. These participants will all undergo the same stimulation test with 0.1 mg LHRH, 0.2 mg TRH, and 0.25 mg ACTH (Synachten). The tests will be perfomed at the same time of day for all particpants (between 08:15 and 08:45) and participants will be fasting for the test. Blood samples will be taken just before and at 10, 20, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes following the stimulation test. Serum from blood samples will be stored at -20 degrees until analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in area under the curve in TSH.
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be measured by calculating the area under the curve adjusted for the basal level for the time of the test period.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in area under the curve in Prolactin.
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be measured by calculating the area under the curve adjusted for the basal level for the time of the test period.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in area under the curve in LH.
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be measured by calculating the area under the curve adjusted for the basal level for the time of the test period.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in area under the curve in FSH.
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be measured by calculating the area under the curve adjusted for the basal level for the time of the test period.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in area under the curve in Cortisol.
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be measured by calculating the area under the curve adjusted for the basal level for the time of the test period.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in peak values in TSH
other_outcome.description: Both absolute peak values and peak values relative to basal level will be calculated.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in peak values in Prolactin
other_outcome.description: Both absolute peak values and peak values relative to basal level will be calculated.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in peak values in LH
other_outcome.description: Both absolute peak values and peak values relative to basal level will be calculated.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in peak values in FSH
other_outcome.description: Both absolute peak values and peak values relative to basal level will be calculated.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in peak values in Cortisol
other_outcome.description: Both absolute peak values and peak values relative to basal level will be calculated.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in time to peak for TSH.
other_outcome.description: Delayed responses will be examined by inspecting curves and by comparing area under the curve at the different blood sampling time points during the test.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in time to peak for Prolactin.
other_outcome.description: Delayed responses will be examined by inspecting curves and by comparing area under the curve at the different blood sampling time points during the test.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in time to peak for LH.
other_outcome.description: Delayed responses will be examined by inspecting curves and by comparing area under the curve at the different blood sampling time points during the test.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in time to peak for FSH.
other_outcome.description: Delayed responses will be examined by inspecting curves and by comparing area under the curve at the different blood sampling time points during the test.

other_outcome.measure: Differences in time to peak for Cortisol.
other_outcome.description: Delayed responses will be examined by inspecting curves and by comparing area under the curve at the different blood sampling time points during the test.

intervention.description: Pituitary stimulation with 0.1 mg LHRH, 0.2 mg TRH and 0.25 mg ACTH

study_pop.textblock: Adults across different age groups without conditions affecting pituitary function. Minimum sample size has been determined by power calculation to be 15 participants. The study aims to include up 24 particpants to increase power in the primary analysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages between 18-45 or above 55.
- Healthy Volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medication or conditions affecting pituitary response (such as hormonal birth control, steriod use, thyroid disorders)
- Pregnancy or birth within the last year
- inability to give informed consent

facility.name: Department of Geriatric Medicine, Aalborg University Hospital
